bill.title: Apportioning state representative districts.

history.action: Introduced (in recess of) 01/06/2021 and referred to Special Committee on Redistricting House Journal  2 P. 55

Public Hearing: 03/09/2021 10:00 am Members of the public may attend using the following link:To join the webinar: https://www.zoom.us/j/94125334680 / Executive session on pending legislation may be held throughout the day (time permitting) from the time the committee is initially convened.

calendar.location: Members of the public may attend using the following link:To joi
calendar.description: Special Committee on Redistricting Public Hearing

bill.full_text: state representative districts rsa is repealed and reenacted to read as follows state representative districts the state is divided into districts for the choosing of state no claremont ward claremont ward claremont ward district no acworth charlestown goshen langdon lempster washington application the changes in state representative districts established by this act shall not affect constituencies or terms of office of representatives presently in office the state representative districts established by this act shall be in effect for the purpose of electing representatives at the state general election if there shall be a vacancy in a state representatives district for any reason prior to the state general election the vacancy shall be filled by and from the same state representative district that existed for the state general election no provision of this act shall affect in any manner any of the proceedings of the membership of the house of representatives of the general court that assembled for a biennial session in january
